Name: VILLON
Address: 1100 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA
Types: night_club, restaurant, food, bar, point_of_interest, establishment
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 2:00 PM, Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 2:00 PM, Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 2:00 PM, Thursday: 7:00 AM – 2:00 PM, Friday: 7:00 AM – 2:00 PM, Saturday: 8:00 AM – 2:00 PM, Sunday: 8:00 AM – 2:00 PM
Review Text:
What a wonderful breakfast AT A HOTEL!

Was shocked by the quality of the food here and so pleased. After a long trip/travel day sometimes all I crave is a nice hardy breakfast and I got it here! Best part is I didn’t have to go looking for it. It was right in my lobby.

Thank you to the wonderful servers that provided incredible service and gave me some time and space while I worked. Such a wonderful spot to go to for brunch if you’re in the area or someone is visiting.
Popular Dish/Drink: Based on the reviews, the most mentioned dish or drink is the Negroni.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently enjoyed brunch at Villon with some friends. We ordered the Negroni cocktails, which were so tasty! The elegant ambiance coupled with the exquisite stonefruit salad made it an absolutely lovely dining experience. 

I noticed on their hours that Villon is open for breakfast and lunch service before closing between 2-3pm. Based on this, I would recommend Michelle plan to stop by either early in their breakfast service around 8am or after the lunch rush around 1:30pm. Both times should provide a quieter dining experience for her to enjoy.

Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:

Name: Acquerello
Address: NEAR VAN NESS &, 1722 Sacramento St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:30 – 9:30 PM, Wednesday: 5:30 – 9:30 PM, Thursday: 5:30 – 9:30 PM, Friday: 5:30 – 9:45 PM, Saturday: 5:30 – 9:45 PM, Sunday: Closed
Review Text: Acquerello is much deserved two star Michelin restaurant.   It is in that rarefied air where a meal becomes a combination of food, art and performance.   Every course and mid course is a unique experience.   The wagyu steak was the finest piece of meat I’ve ever eaten in my life.  I took as small of bites as possible because it was so flavorful that tiniest piece would make your whole mouth water.  Just like any other Michelin starred restaurant you can expect to spend about $300- 400 per person after tax and tip for the tasting menu, depending upon what you have to drink and supplements.
Popular Dish/Drink: Based on the reviews, the most popular or most mentioned dish seems to be the pasta. Multiple reviews specifically call out and praise the homemade pasta dishes.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently visited Acquerello with some friends. We ordered several of the homemade pasta dishes, which were incredibly flavorful and perfectly cooked. Our server was also very welcoming and helped guide us to an amazing meal. 

I would suggest Michelle plan to visit on a Wednesday or Thursday evening right at 5:30pm when they open. This timing should allow her to experience the restaurant before the dinner rush starts. Another good option could be Saturday at 5:30pm, although weekends may generally be a bit busier.

Name: Rich Table
Address: 199 Gough St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 – 10:30 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 10:30 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 10:30 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 10:30 PM, Sunday: Closed
Review Text:
Absolutely delicious and seasonal menu that doesn’t get stale. The flavor was exquisitely balanced. Dishes taste exciting and refreshing.  Everything we ordered has something an unexpected ingredient, the pomegranate in the truffle, the green curry in the roasted cauliflower, the miso in the pear, just wonderful.
Plenty of vegetarian dishes and vegan options.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I stopped in last week with some friends and we ordered the uni pasta - it was so delicious, and the ambiance was so cozy and lively. The staff were extremely friendly and welcoming as well. We had the best time! 

I'd recommend Michelle stop by on a Wednesday or Thursday around 5:30 PM, right after they open for dinner service. That hour before the dinner rush starts would be perfect for her to talk to the staff before they get too busy. Another good option may be visiting on a Monday or Tuesday when they are closed, if she could arrange that.

Name: Sons & Daughters
Address: 708 Bush St, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00 – 8:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 – 8:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 8:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 8:30 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 8:30 PM, Sunday: Closed
Review Text:
Sons and Daughters was such an incredible experience from start to finish. Right when we sat down, there was this sweet, handwritten card waiting for us—it was such a thoughtful little touch that made the night feel special from the get-go.

Every dish was just stunning—like, they were almost too pretty to eat. But the flavors? Even better. You could tell so much creativity went into every detail, from how the food looked to how it all tasted together. Each bite felt super intentional.

I also loved that they offered a non-alcoholic drink pairing. Every drink matched the food perfectly, and it was such a cool option to have.

Overall, it was one of those meals where you’re smiling the whole time because everything is just so good.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently enjoyed an incredible meal at Sons & Daughters. We ordered the lobster, which was expertly prepared and incredibly flavorsome. The service was also fantastic - the staff were so friendly and made our dinner a wonderful experience. 

Based on their opening hours, I would suggest Michelle stops by on a Wednesday or Thursday, shortly after they open at 6pm. Coming right at opening time on a weeknight may allow Michelle to chat with the staff and chef when business is slower, before the dinner rush starts. Another good option could be Saturday around 5:15pm, within the first 15 minutes of them opening for dinner service.

Name: La Société Bar & Café
Address: 50 3rd St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA
Types: bar, cafe, restaurant, food, point_of_interest, establishment
Review Text:
Came here for the “le petit chef” experience by Skullmapping.
Everything was on point. Service was punctual and professional, amazing food and overall experience extremely special. Kids loved it, adults probably enjoyed even more. Will certainly do it again next time they’re in town
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I stopped in a couple weeks ago with my friends and we ordered the steak tartare - it was so delicious, and the ambiance was so warm and inviting. The staff was also incredibly thoughtful and friendly, gifting a scoop of ice cream for a birthday celebration at our table. We had the best time!  

Based on the opening hours, I would suggest Michelle plan to visit on a Wednesday or Thursday afternoon between 2-4PM, after the lunch rush but before the dinner crowd comes in. Another good option could be Saturday late-morning around 10:30AM.

Name: Absinthe Brasserie & Bar
Address: 398 Hayes St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Review Text: We arrived at the restaurant right when it opened at 11:30, which turned out to be a great decision—perfect timing before the crowds. We got a cozy table for two, and our waitress was exceptionally polite and friendly, making us feel very welcome. For our meal, we ordered the duck confit and the burger, both of which were absolutely delicious and generously portioned. The highlight, however, was the chilled mussels we had as a starter—they were incredibly fresh and sweet, an unexpected delight. On top of the great food, the prices were very reasonable for lunch, making it an excellent value. I would definitely recommend this place and plan to bring my friends here next time!
Popular Dish/Drink: Based on the reviews, the most popular or most-mentioned dish seems to be the duck. The duck confit and duck breast with truffle accompaniment are specifically highlighted in multiple reviews as exceptional stand out dishes at Absinthe Brasserie & Bar.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is a suggested intro blurb and recommendation for when to visit:
Suggested Times:
I enjoyed a lovely lunch with friends recently at Absinthe Brasserie & Bar. We ordered the duck confit - it was incredibly flavorful and tender. Our server was very friendly, making us feel right at home in the cozy ambiance. 

I'd recommend Michelle plan to visit on a Wednesday or Thursday afternoon right when they open at 11:30am. Since they are closed Monday and Tuesday, it should be quieter earlier in the week. A Tuesday dinner after the evening rush around 8:45pm could also be an ideal relaxed time.

Name: Tratto
Address: 501 Geary St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA
Review Text:
Such a warm and welcoming spot. Service is perfect! We were stopping for a quick dinner near the ACT and our waiter couldn't have been more accommodating.  We needed to leave by a certain time and he made that happen for us.

Our food was delicious. My husband had the fish of the day. Each bite melted in your mouth. I had the butter nut squash pizza.  Item I never would have thought to put on a pizza myself but it was yummy.

Desert we had the fresh made donuts with caramel sauce. Words cannot describe how amazing these were you'll have to go check them out personally.

We will definitely be returning.
Popular Dish/Drink: Based on the reviews, there is no single dish or drink that seems most popular or most-mentioned. The reviews mention a variety of dishes like bagels, salmon toast, fish of the day, butter nut squash pizza, donuts, pepperoni pizza, calamari, Prosecco, french toast, bacon, hot chocolate, and pizza. There is no clear standout that is discussed repeatedly across the reviews.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
Paragraph #1: 
I stopped in last weekend with my friends and we ordered several pizzas to share - the butter nut squash pizza was so delicious! The ambiance was very warm and welcoming. We had the best time catching up over great food and drinks.

Paragraph #2: 
Based on the opening hours, I would suggest Michelle plan to stop by either early in the morning right when they open at 7 AM any weekday to beat the breakfast rush, or mid-afternoon on Monday through Thursday between 1:30 PM and 5 PM when the lunch crowd has tapered off and before the dinner rush begins. Those seem like they would be the slowest times.

Dining at Harris’ Steakhouse was an unforgettable experience! From the moment we stepped inside, the warm and inviting ambience set the tone for the evening.

The starters were a delightful introduction—perfectly crafted cocktails that were both refreshing and expertly balanced. But the highlight of the night was undoubtedly the steak. The service was impeccable, attentive yet unobtrusive, ensuring that we felt cared for throughout the evening.

Harris’ truly embodies the classic steakhouse vibe with a touch of modern sophistication. I highly recommend this gem to anyone seeking a luxurious and memorable dining experience in San Francisco!

Types: bakery, store, restaurant, food, point_of_interest, establishment
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Thursday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Friday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Saturday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Sunday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Review Text:
After years of anticipation, I finally had breakfast here. The decaf latte was excellent, with rich steamed milk.

The egg Benedict on a croissant was a unique and delicious collaboration. Beware of the hard avocado on the bread.

The cakes were fantastic overall, though the chocolate parts were a bit too sweet for my liking.

The pistachio cake, however, was phenomenal. I'll definitely be back soon.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently visited with some friends and we tried the croissant smoked salmon Benedict egg sandwich, which was absolute perfection. The service was quick and kind, and the ambiance is cozy and relaxed, perfect for lingering over coffee and pastries. 

I'd suggest Michelle plan to stop by on a Wednesday mid-afternoon, perhaps around 2 or 3pm when it may be quieter following the lunch rush. Alternatively, visiting on a Sunday mid-morning around 10 or 11am could work as well, before the post-church crowds arrive.

Name: Son and Garden
Address: 700 Polk St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 AM – 2:30 PM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 2:30 PM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 2:30 PM, 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 2:30 PM, 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 2:30 PM, 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM, 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM, 5:00 – 9:00 PM
Review Text:
While visiting San Francisco, I stumbled upon Son & Garden on Instagram and decided to check it out. When I arrived around 1 PM, I was surprised to see the place packed with people! I was traveling alone and decided to stop by for a meal. Luckily, I didn’t have to wait for a table as there was one available just in time—such great luck!

I ordered the Belly Ranchero and a Cappuccino, and they were absolutely amazing. The food was flavorful, beautifully presented, and so satisfying. The restaurant’s atmosphere was unique and vibrant, and almost every dish and drink I saw looked so tempting.

Since I was dining alone, I only ordered a couple of items, but I would love to come back and try more the next time I visit San Francisco.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently visited Son & Garden while traveling through San Francisco. I tried the cappuccino, which was delicious. The atmosphere was so vibrant and inviting, with beautiful floral decorations. My friend and I had the best lunch experience.  

Based on the opening hours, some times that Michelle could stop by when it may not be as busy are Wednesday between 2:30 PM - 5:00 PM or Thursday between 2:30 PM - 5:00 PM, before the dinner rush begins. Another option is Saturday between 3:00 PM - 5:00 PM, after the Saturday lunch customers have cleared out.

Name: Top of the Mark
Address: 999 California St, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 3:00 PM – 12:30 AM, Saturday: 3:00 PM – 12:30 AM, Sunday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM
Review Text: They are the best!! The attention to detail is amazing. The asparagus pizza is so good it has a lemon sauce on it that is delicious. Shrimp tacos are very good, and the beef short rib sliders id say are very tasty,  hummus is also one that i like a lot. Blueberry cobbler, a strawberry cake with these little dehydrated strawberries on top of it, the caviar is always good, i had a scotch on the rocks they have ice cubes with there logo on them. Very cool!! We also had this little fruit tart that had a good custard in it. We also had a bottle of champagne, a bottle of red wine. I always enjoy going here so much, for the ambience and the great service.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently visited Top of the Mark with some friends and we ordered the short rib sliders, which were delicious. The atmosphere was elegant yet relaxed, and the staff provided excellent service. It was a wonderful evening taking in the views and enjoying good company. 

Based on the opening hours, I would suggest Michelle plan to visit on a Wednesday or Thursday afternoon, perhaps around 5pm after any lunch rush but before the dinner crowd arrives. Alternately, I think arriving right at opening time on Fridays or Saturdays, around 3pm, could also be a nice quieter time before the weekends get busier in the evenings.

Name: Prospect Park Grille
Address: 1633 Broadway, Oakland, CA 94612, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:30 AM – 2:00 PM, Tuesday: 6:30 AM – 2:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:30 AM – 2:00 PM, Thursday: 6:30 AM – 2:00 PM, Friday: 6:30 AM – 2:00 PM, Saturday: 7:00 AM – 2:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Review Text:
We were headed for Alameda to snag some Philapino food, but I had to stop and grab a simple grilled cheese sandwich from the Prospect Park Grille first, and for two very strong reasons...1- they're the best grilled cheese sandwiches in the world!  And 2- Philapino food is great, but it doesn't fill me up so I have to eat first.
The Prospect Park Grille is 5 stars all day long!  ☆☆☆☆☆
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently visited Prospect with some friends and we tried the grilled cheese sandwich, which multiple reviews highlighted as a popular item. It definitely lived up to the hype - the cheese was perfectly melty and it really hit the spot. The super friendly service also added to the cozy cafe ambiance. 

Based on the opening hours, two good times for Michelle to visit when it may be quieter are:
Wednesday at 1:00 PM, after the main lunch rush. 
Thursday at 5:00 PM, between the lunch and dinner rushes.

Name: Gary Danko
Address: 800 North Point St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM
Review Text:
My son and I had an amazing experience at Gary Danko tonight. I have wanted to try this restaurant for a long time, had high expectations, and was not disappointed. We both ordered the 3 course tasting menu, I paired mine with the wine suggestions, which perfectly matched the meal.

Each dish we had was outstanding, and the service was maybe the best I've ever experienced at any restaurant. We couldn't recommend a special occasion meal at Gary Danko highly enough! This restaurant is special.
Popular Dish/Drink: Based on the reviews, there is no single dish or drink that stands out as being most popular or most mentioned. The reviews mention enjoying various dishes and the overall dining experience, but no specific item is called out multiple times across the different reviews.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently enjoyed a lovely anniversary dinner at Gary Danko. We had the tasting menu with expert wine pairings and truly memorable service from our server Kira. Every dish was outstanding and it was a wonderful dining experience we won't soon forget. 

Based on the opening hours listed, I would suggest Michelle plan to stop by on a Thursday or Sunday evening, shortly after opening at 5pm. Arriving at that time would be before the main dinner rush on the weekends, but still allow plenty of time to enjoy a full meal. Two recommended days and times for a quieter dining experience: Thursdays at 5:30pm or Sundays at 5:15pm.

Name: Lazy Bear
Address: 3416 19th St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 4:45 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 4:45 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 4:45 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 4:45 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 4:45 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Review Text: Celebrated my fiancé’s birthday here and they left no stones unturned in the food and service. Choicest of ingredients prepared with passion and served spectacularly with panache. It’s as good as fine dining gets. Besides the warmth and attentiveness of the staff, wanna call out how they go above and beyond in ensuring that it’s one of your most memorable nights dining out. An anecdote is, one of the servers noted our interest in hot sauces from my questions about the dishes, and we had an experimental hot sauce to-go from the chef with our breakfast for next day. Can’t recommend Lazy Bear enough 🐻
Popular Dish/Drink: Based on the reviews, the most mentioned and popular dish seems to be the Fondue, described as a "very creamy gnocchi dish with black truffle".
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently visited with some friends and we tried the fondue, which lived up to its reputation as a rich, creamy gnocchi dish with black truffle. The warm, attentive service really made the night special. 

I'd recommend Michelle plan to visit on a Wednesday or Thursday evening right at opening time around 4:45 PM. Since they just open for dinner at that time, it likely won't be too crowded yet. Alternatively, I'd suggest going later in the evening closer to 9:30 PM when they are getting ready to close.

Name: Dirty Habit
Address: 12 4th St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA
Review Text: This is a great place to eat, drink and lounge around.  The tables are spread nicely apart and the ambiance is dark and intimate.  I had the fish and the chips and the fish was so fresh, it just melted in my mouth.   I also had the French martini and it tasted like raspberry liquid candy.  It was delicious!  There's a very cool patio where you can enjoy the company of a group of friends and apparently, they're planning on restarting happy hour again after stopping it during the pandemic.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I stopped in a couple weeks ago with my friends and we ordered the French martini - it was so delicious, and the ambiance was so intimate and cool. We had the best time relaxing on the patio!  

I'd recommend Michelle stop by either on a Monday or Tuesday right when they open for dinner at 4pm. Since it's the start of the week, it likely won't be too crowded yet at that time. Another good time might be Saturday late morning right before 11am, after the breakfast rush has died down.

Name: Liholiho Yacht Club
Address: 871 Sutter St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Review Text:
Liholiho is a great place to try innovative flavor mixes that you normally don’t see - tropical done in such a unique way using high quality ingredients, bravo!

Highlight is definitely the Pork chop with pomegranate, the flavors were surprisingly delicate and I’d come back just to eat this again. Gulf shrimp with orange was also unexpected but the texture with the grain was a bit too much. Beef tongue buns were almost melt in mouth and a great way to showcase a less used cut of meat. Lowlight was the sesame noodles, had high hopes but they just tasted goopy and bland.

Staff were very friendly and helpful with menu recommendations. Atmosphere is like attending a dinner party your bougie friends hosted - mellow music, tasteful decorations, and slightly too loud conversations.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently celebrated a birthday at Liholiho with a group of friends. We ordered the pork chop dish and it was phenomenal - the flavors were so unique and well-balanced. The service was also incredibly friendly and made us feel right at home. We had such a lovely celebratory evening!

Based on their opening hours, I would suggest Michelle stops by on either a Monday or Tuesday evening between 5:30-6pm, just as they are opening for dinner service. The restaurant likely won't be too busy yet during that window. Alternatively, Wednesday or Thursday from 2-3pm could work as well, between the lunch and dinner rushes.

Name: Sisterita
Address: 669 Commercial St, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA

Review Text:
During my recent visit to San Francisco, California, I had the pleasure of enjoying breakfast at Sisterita. I discovered this charming spot while searching for nearby restaurants around my hotel and was immediately drawn to its appeal. When I arrived, I was impressed by the warm and inviting atmosphere, with a unique and thoughtfully designed interior that gives the place its own personality. Despite the restaurant being packed with customers, I was fortunate to be seated quickly at the bar since I was dining alone.

I ordered the steak and eggs, which were both flavorful and beautifully plated. The dish was satisfying, and the overall presentation was excellent. The staff here truly stood out with their outstanding service—friendly, attentive, and consistently ensuring that all guests felt welcome and cared for.

Sisterita’s menu offers a wide variety of options, catering to all tastes. While I didn’t get to explore many dishes this time due to feeling a bit tired from my travels, the delightful ambiance and exceptional service left a lasting impression. I’m already planning to return and try more of their offerings on my next visit.

If you’re in San Francisco and looking for a quality breakfast spot with great food, exceptional service, and a cozy atmosphere, I highly recommend Sisterita. It’s a true gem that’s well worth a visit!
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently enjoyed brunch at Sisterita and tried their popular French Toast Brioche. It was absolutely delicious! The atmosphere was charming and cozy, and the staff provided exceptional service. My friends and I had a wonderful morning there. 

I suggest Michelle plan to visit on a Wednesday or Thursday around 1:30pm. Being after the breakfast and lunch rushes, she should be able to enjoy Sisterita's warm ambiance and chat with the staff when it's quieter. Alternatively, I propose Michelle go on a Tuesday at 10:30am before the lunch crowds arrive.

Name: Empress by Boon
Address: 838 Grant Ave, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Review Text: It was my birthday dinner. Not gonna lie when our Uber arrived in Chinatown, I was initially a bit disappointed. As someone born and raised in China, I usually have 0 expectations for Chinese food in SF. However, Empress by Boon completely won me over (or maybe my boyfriend impressed me ;)). It was without a doubt the best meal I’ve had in SF! The stunning view of the city and the gorgeous ambiance only added to the experience. Every dish we ordered was incredible, with beautiful presentation and rich flavors. From the fish shaped shrimp dumplings to the slow braised pork and the innovative Peking duck, even the simple stir fried vegetables were exceptional. I had a wonderful evening there and left thoroughly impressed, grateful and happy!
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently visited with some friends and we tried the dumplings, which were delicious. The views of the city and modern decor really made for a special night out. 

I'd suggest Michelle stops by on a Wednesday or Thursday evening around 5:30pm, right as they open for dinner service. Earlier in the week may be quieter than the weekend nights.

Name: Saison
Address: 178 Townsend St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Sunday: Closed
Review Text:
To this day, my 2015 dinner at Saison Restaurant was still the most I’ve ever spent on a meal. It was an incredible experience, but the cost had deterred me from revisiting. Fast forward to last month, and I was pinching myself, because I got a sneak peek of their new $58 bar prix fixe experience. Yes, you are reading that right, $58 to dine at a two-Michelin star restaurant. This does not include drinks, and I would call this more of a snack rather than a full meal. But you receive the same starting canapés that they serve in their full tasting menu, along with a brioche bread miso course, tea, and dessert.

There’s also the option to add supplements including their iconic sea urchin grilled sourdough toast. The uni toast alone is about the cost of the snack menu, and with other supplements and drinks your tab can easily add up, but the flexibility of having a lower starting point is incredible. The bar experience is only available Tuesday-Thursday, and word has gotten out, so reservations are quite sparse, but looks like they do release rolling daily reservations three months out.

If you go in with the expectation of snacking, you will have a great experience. The kitchen led by chef Richard Lee put out phenomenal small bites. My friend and I also had a great time sitting at the bar and chatting with Peter and team. Wonderful service all around.
Popular Dish/Drink: Based on the reviews, the most popular/most-mentioned dish seems to be the sea urchin (uni) grilled sourdough toast.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently visited Saison for their special bar menu and was so impressed by the incredible sea urchin toast dish and the friendly service. The bartender chatted with me throughout the meal and perfectly matched cocktails to each course. The intimate vibe at the bar made for a fun night out.  

Based on their hours, I'd suggest Michelle stops by on a Tuesday or Wednesday between 5:00 and 5:30pm, before the dinner service gets too busy. Alternatively, she could go on a Thursday between 2:00 and 3:00pm, since they only serve the bar and bites snacks during their off hours.

Review Text: Had the best experience this morning at Roxanne's Cafe. I've enjoyed this place for years, and my wife and I have many fond memories here. I always make it a point to stop by when I'm in SF. Today, I was the only patron during breakfast and had a wonderful conversation with Consuela, who has been here for 23 years. She's an amazing, beautiful human. Beyond the perfect Eggs Benedict, it's Consuela who makes Roxanne's a must-visit in SF.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently visited Roxanne Cafe for brunch and ordered their popular Eggs Benedict, which was absolutely delicious! The staff was so friendly and welcoming, it made for a wonderful dining experience. My friends and I had a great morning catching up over some tasty food in the cozy cafe.

Based on their opening hours, some good times for Michelle to drop in would be: Tuesday or Thursday between 3:00-4:00 PM, after the lunch rush but before dinner service begins. Another option could be Saturday morning around 8:30 AM before it gets too busy later on.

Name: HK Lounge Bistro
Address: 1136 Folsom St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 2:30 PM, 5:00 – 8:30 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 2:30 PM, 5:00 – 8:30 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 2:30 PM, 5:00 – 8:30 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 2:30 PM, 5:00 – 8:30 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 2:30 PM, 5:00 – 8:30 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 2:30 PM, 5:00 – 8:30 PM
Review Text:
HK Lounge bistro is an upscale dim sum restaurant in San Francisco. The restaurant is a bit small, so I recommend reservations for large parties.

I went both in the afternoon and evening to try their dim sum and dinner menu. Their dim sum menu has all the traditional dishes.

Their hargow and cheung fun was soft and fresh. The baked buns were savory and sweet. Everything came out fairly fast and was fresh and delicious.

I visited another time during dinner and got the steamed chilean seabass with tofu. The tofu and seabass were soft topped with plenty black bean sauce. We also got the glazed coffee berkshire pork ribs. The glazed coffee ribs were a bit too sweet for my taste and were okay.

The servers were friendly and checked on us quite often.

Overall, HK Lounge Bistro was one of my favorite dim sum/Chinese restaurants in San Francisco, and they have a variety of different dishes to choose from.
Popular Dish/Drink: Based on the reviews, the most popular/most-mentioned dish seems to be the dim sum.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the requested response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I visited HK Lounge Bistro a couple weekends ago with some friends to try their famous dim sum. The dishes were authentic and delicious, and the staff was very friendly and attentive. We had such a nice afternoon chatting away while enjoying delicately crafted dumplings and buns. 

Based on their opening hours, I would suggest Michelle stop by either on a Wednesday after the lunch rush around 2:45 pm, or on a Monday later in the afternoon around 4:30 pm before the dinner crowd arrives. Name: Comstock Saloon
Address: 155 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Review Text: It’s retro , classy, design feels  like you have walked into the 1940s; I wish I was wearing a suit with fedora, with Lauren Bacall at my side; a long wooden rotating fan that looks like an oar is designed to mesmerize patrons to keep ordering drinks and food;  Love the fried  Brussels sprouts. The jazz band is curiously situated a level above bar as if they are a voice of God? I bet the band is called Zeus. And they use the trombone for a clarion call to the world !
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I met up with some old friends at Comstock Saloon last week. We got the donuts with ice cream for the table - they were absolutely delicious! The ambiance was classy and vibrant, with the live jazz band playing upbeat tunes. It really added to the fun, relaxed vibe.  

I'd suggest Michelle stops by on a Wednesday or Thursday right at 4pm when they open. That way she can check things out when it's quieter before the evening rush. Another good time might be Fridays between 2-4pm, after the lunch crowd but before the early evening customers start trickling in.

Name: The ThongLor SF - Thai Restaurant
Address: 420 Geary St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

Legit Hole in the Wall!

Name: The Morris
Address: 2501 Mariposa St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Tuesday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Sunday: Closed
Review Text:
Having enjoyed delicious dishes and good service in many settings, The Morris is still one of my favorite restaurants.

Each dish is made with care. The flavor, texture, temperature, even colors are great for the eyes, the nose, the tongue, appealing to so many senses.

Staff is courteous, knowledgeable, and professional. It is also consistent, which matters.

They are environmentally conscious, which you can tell from the napkins to hand towels in the bathroom.

The menu is varied, so whether you are a vegan or meat lover, you will find something that will delight your senses.

The bar staff is excellent, serving cocktails at just the right temperature and just like the food, it is excellent.  And I haven't even mentioned the extensive spirits menu :) come find out yourself.

Absolutely worth the trip.

Name: Red Robin Gourmet Burgers and Brews
Address: 1274 El Camino Real, San Bruno, CA 94066, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Review Text:
I used to come here a lot when I was in high school.  Nowadays, not so much.   I recently ate here with my niece for lunch, and I'm surprised to see this place hasn't changed at all.  They've definitely maintained this place well.   From what I could see, everything was clean and bright. They got rid of the arcade, and it's now where you pick up take-out orders.
We were greeted and seated right away.  The server was nice.  The food came out fast and fresh.  They still had the freckled lemonade that I remembered.
I had ordered the shroom burger, and it was flavorful and juicy.  The fries were ok,  I remember we used to tell them to keep the fries coming because they were that good.  Something was different, that I can't pinpoint.  We didn't even finish the fries they provided with the meal.
We ordered mozzarella sticks, which is a standard appetizer, nice and cheesy, which had a good cheesy pull when you bite it.
Overall, it was a good nostalgic experience.   It's just crazy to see that not much has changed.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently visited Robin with some old high school friends. We ordered the freckled lemonade, which was just as delicious as I remembered from years ago. The service was attentive and friendly, and the ambiance made me nostalgic for my younger days. 

I'd suggest Michelle stops by on a Tuesday or Wednesday right after the lunch rush, around 2-3pm. Alternatively, visiting an hour before closing around 9pm on a weeknight could work as well.

Name: Urban Tavern
Address: 333 O'Farrell St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA
Review Text: I decided to eat here due to it being at my hotel. I made the right choice. When you walk in, you’ll notice a hipster atmosphere. It’s not bad or anything, but you might not expect it. The menu might also come of as strange for people who aren’t used to very hipster style food. Luckily, I’m used to it. I ordered the 8 hour bolognese. When they slow cook tagliatelle for 8 hours, you know that it’s gonna be good! It was surprisingly one of the best pasta dishes I’ve ever had! Plus, the fries are OUTSTANDING (I tried my dad’s fries). However, DO NOT SKIP DESSERT! All of them are incredible. I got the Coconut-Guava Roche. It’s basically coconut and guava mousse with bits of tapioca and gelatine. It was AWESOME! So was my brother’s S’mores Sundae (marshmallow flavoured ice cream with toasted marshmallows and graham crackers) and my parents’ Carrot Cake (not what you’d expect a carrot cake to look like, but don’t let it fool you!)! I will have to recommend Urban Tavern to everyone I know. You’ll love it!
Intro Email Blurb: Here is a suggested intro email and proposed times for a restaurant visit:
Suggested Times:
I recently enjoyed a fantastic meal at Urban Tavern. Their signature 8 hour bolognese dish was remarkably flavorful. Between the lively atmosphere and attentive staff, it made for an extremely pleasant dining experience that I won't soon forget. 

Given the undefined opening hours, I would propose the following less busy times for a convenient visit: Weekday late afternoons between 2-4pm before the dinner rush begins would likely be ideal. Name: Om Sabor
Address: 370 Grove St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Review Text:
Om Sabor was an incredible plant-based dining experience that left my heart feeling happy and taste buds extremely satisfied.

They offer open seating in their bar area, back room, and even outside. Once seated, our waiter came over to give us all the menus including their weekday happy hour (17:00 - 19:00), mains, and drinks.

We started with their Carne Asada Tacos and Ceviche Tostadas from the happy hour menu. Both were phenomenal. The ceviche was fresh on top of crispy corn tortilla and the mock carne asada was flavorful that you really couldn't tell it apart from the meat version.

For our mains, we shared a few items for the table including the Carne Asada Nachos, Oyster Mushroom Calamari (HIT!), Crispy Mushroom Potato Gratin (heavenly), and their Teriyaki Chicken Skewers. Every single item we had was delicious, well executed, and surprisingly very filling which was good since the pricing is higher being in the city. I would go back for anything mushroom related especially that calamari - one of my favorite crispy mushroom dishes.

We had a fantastic experience and I am eager to return to try more of their dishes and drinks.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
Paragraph #1: 
I stopped in a couple weeks ago with some friends to try out Om Sabor's popular Spicy Margarita dish. It was delicious! The ambience was trendy and cozy, with chill music playing. We had a great time chatting over tasty food and drinks.

Paragraph #2: 
Based on their opening hours, I would suggest Michelle stops by either on a Tuesday around 5:30pm, right after they open and before the dinner rush, or on a Wednesday or Thursday around 8:30pm, after the dinner rush has died down. Those seem like good times where the restaurant is less busy but still lively.

whole name: One Market Restaurant/Mark 'n Mike's NY Style Deli
Name: One Market Restaurant/Mark 'n Mike's NY Style Deli
Address: 1 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94105, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 8:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 8:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 8:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 8:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 8:00 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Review Text:
It’s a completely standard mid-century-wanna-be brown and black new-American white-apron joint, frequented by folks wearing suit-jackets over unbuttoned top-button blue shirts.  You probably know the type of place, with old jazz standards playing and the dirtiest martinis on the block.

Whether or not that’s your thing, though, doesn’t really matter. What matters is that the Reuben is absolutely epic in *quality* (more important than size).  Perfectly griddled rye bread, stupidly tender pastrami, and a beautiful balance of acid, sweetness, and fattiness.  The meat is sliced thicker than most, but it’s a convincing argument for adjustment to the genre.  Everything at this joint is solid, but the Reuben is worth five stars by itself.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
Paragraph 1: I was missing some traditional Jewish fare from my Chicago days recently, so I checked out One Market Restaurant/Mark 'n Mike's NY Style Deli in the Financial District. I tried their Reuben sandwich which was absolutely epic - perfect rye bread and incredibly tender pastrami. The vibe was great too, very supportive for business discussions over a meal.  

Paragraph 2: Based on their opening hours, I would suggest Michelle stop by either on a Wednesday or Thursday around 2pm, which is likely after the lunch rush. Another good time might be between 5-6pm before the dinner rush really gets going.

We decided to host our reception dinner here because of the convenient location, amazing food, and a nice view with ferry building as the background. We reserved half of the dinner area and the outdoor patio for the party at night.

Tiffany was our event coordinator and she's amazing! She explained everything clearly and got back to us in a timely manner. Staffs at the dinner was very very patient throughout the whole event ~10pm. The service is #1. The manager of the bar even asked me to take a shot with him at the end. I was very surprised by the quality of the cocktail here. I loved the bartenders and they made the drinks super quick. The dessert table was a nice touch. I got no complains but tons of complements about the quality of the food. How fresh and how yummy they are.

Name: Surisan
Address: 505 Beach St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
Review Text: This place is the best Korean place I've ever been to. There was no wait time, and the service was fast and reliable, we got our food within 15 minutes. In addition, the waiters were always nearby asking us if we needed anything. The atmosphere was great, lots of people had birthdays so a lot of birthday songs. Everyone just seemed really happy in there. 🎂 There was also Christmas music playing (we came right before Christmas). Finally, the food. Top-notch, especially for the price. The portions are pretty good too, four of us were fine eating only 3 entrees. I recommend getting the Korean fried chicken, especially with soy and garlic and sweet and spicy sauce. The cost before tips and taxes was 75 dollars, which for 3 utterly scrumptious dishes is a really good deal. I would definitely come back here. 👍

Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10:30 AM – 3:00 PM, 4:30 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:30 AM – 3:00 PM, 4:30 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 10:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 10:30 AM – 3:00 PM, 4:30 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 10:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 10:30 AM – 10:00 PM
Review Text:
Insanely good Indian / Nepalese food!! 🔥 regular spot to eat!

Our favorites
- Almond cashew curry w/ coconut milk (protein: veg tofu)
- veg chili momo (not too spicy, really good ~8 dumplings)
- Yarsa chaat (the crunchy chickpea batter was so delicious)
- cheese naan (so fluffy!)

Portion sizes are good value. Tried the Ginger garlic curry but wasn’t our favorite. Tons of vegetarian options and almost everything can be gluten free
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently tried the naan at Yarsa Nepalese Cuisine and it totally exceeded my expectations - so fluffy and delicious! The cozy atmosphere made for such a lovely dining experience with my friends. 

Michelle, you may want to stop by on a Wednesday mid-afternoon, say around 2:30pm before the dinner rush. Another good option is Saturday late-morning around 10:45am, after the breakfast crowd but well before the lunch rush.

Review Text: Food is really good and the service is great in a really cool setting.  The crab cakes were spot on and the beef was nice and tender.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I stopped in last month with my husband for our anniversary dinner. We ordered the delicious crab cakes, and just loved the rustic, charming ambiance. The stone walls and architecture made for such a cozy, memorable evening. 

I'd suggest Michelle stops by on a Wednesday or Thursday evening right at 5pm when they open. Name: Bobo's Bistro
Address: 600 York St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 3:00 PM, 5:00 – 8:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 3:00 PM, 5:00 – 8:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 3:00 PM, 5:00 – 8:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 3:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Review Text:
One of the authentic Vietnamese restaurants in SF.
The dish generally seemed to be prepared with clean and delicate flavors, minimally used artificial seasoning.
Even the peanuts in the sauce tasted good as if they were just roasted, and the broth of pho was neat, not heavy, with a subtle blend of various flavors.
The restaurant chef/owner made small talks kindly sharing stories about herself and we had a good time thanks to her.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I stopped in last week with some friends and we ordered the pho - it was so flavorful and delicious. The owner was so kind and welcoming, we really enjoyed speaking with her. It made for such a lovely dining experience.  

Based on the opening hours, two times that Michelle could stop by when it may be quieter are Wednesdays from 3-5pm between lunch and dinner service, or Saturdays after the lunch rush around 2pm before they close at 3pm.

Name: Franciscan Crab Restaurant
Address: Pier 43 1/2, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

Review Text:
Franciscan Carb Haven is a must-visit for anyone who appreciates the art of indulgent, carb-rich dishes. Whether you're craving pasta, bread, or pastries, this place has something to satisfy every craving. I left feeling content and already planning my next visit.

For the quality and portion sizes, the prices were reasonable. Expect to pay around $15-$20 for most main courses.

The atmosphere was relaxed and inviting, making it a great spot for both casual dining and special occasions. The subtle background music added to the cozy vibe, making it easy to lose track of time while savoring the delicious food.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:

I visited the Franciscan Crab Restaurant last month and ordered their signature Whole Crab (Garlic Butter). It was incredibly tasty and the portion was quite generous. The atmosphere was cozy and welcoming, making it a perfect spot for a relaxing meal with friends. 

Paragraph 2:
Based on their opening hours, I would suggest Michelle stops by on a Tuesday or Wednesday afternoon between 2-4PM. That should be after the lunch rush dies down and before the dinner crowd starts arriving, allowing for a more relaxed dining experience. Alternatively, she could visit on a Monday evening around 5-6PM, as Mondays tend to be slower restaurant nights in general.

Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:

I would recommend Michelle plan to visit either early in the week like Monday or Tuesday right when they open at 5pm to beat most of the dinner rush. Name: Matterhorn Restaurant and Bakery
Address: 2323 Van Ness Ave, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 4:00 – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 4:00 – 9:00 PM
Review Text: Still exactly what it’s always been and even a little better ! I’ve been coming here on and off for years and visited this week for date night with the hubby after a hiatus. We both absolutely loved our food, emphasis on how FRESH everything tasted including crisp salad greens and perfect bread. I sometimes worry in a slower economy that food won’t be as fresh but Matterhorn is keeping everything top notch! We had the super sharp cheese fondue followed by the beef with different sauces, all delightful. I will also mention that I love the music, playing jazz is a great neutral that I feel is romantic and most people can enjoy. Thanks for the awesome culinary experience and lovely atmosphere. Our server was also really informative and explained the menu to us when we had specific questions, especially about which fondue to pick because frankly they all sounded amazing. At the end of our meal we were presented with an adorable plate of complementary cookies. I really feel like the value is great here for the type of experience you get. Can’t wait to come back soon!
Popular Dish/Drink:
Based on the reviews, the most popular/most-mentioned dish or drink at Matterhorn Restaurant and Bakery seems to be fondue. Multiple reviews specifically discuss and praise various fondue dishes, including cheese fondue, chocolate fondue, and fondue with sides. Since "fondue" is repeatedly mentioned favorably across these reviews, I have concluded it is the most popular or discussed menu item at this restaurant.

Therefore, the name of the most popular dish or drink is:

fondue
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently visited with some friends and we tried the fondue, which was absolutely delicious. The cozy, Alpine ambiance made it feel like we were transported straight to Switzerland. Between the tasty food and charming décor, we had a wonderful evening. 

I noticed on their hours that Wednesdays and Thursdays from 5:00 - 6:00 PM could be a good time for Michelle to stop by. Coming right after they open in the early evening, it likely won't be as busy as prime dinner hours. Fridays and Saturdays from 4:00 - 5:00 PM could also work, just before the dinner rush gets going.

Name: Greens
Address: Building A, 2 Marina Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 2:30 PM, 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 2:30 PM, 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 2:30 PM, 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 2:30 PM, 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 10:30 AM – 2:30 PM, 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 10:30 AM – 2:30 PM, 5:00 – 9:00 PM
Review Text: Who would think vegetarian food could taste so good?! The pasta was divine and the pizza, potato cake, Brussels sprouts, and cornbread not to be missed. The spring rolls I could do without. Ambience was a bit dated and so was the crowd - just come here for the food. Attire smart casual. Better than Wildseed for taste in my book. Not for a first date due to ambience.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:

I stopped in last week with a couple friends and we ordered the pasta - it was so delicious! The ambiance was nice with the ocean views, and our server Kathy provided fantastic service. We had such a lovely time catching up over the great food and drinks.

Based on the opening hours, I would suggest Michelle stops by either on a Wednesday or Thursday around 3pm, right after the lunch rush ends. Another good time could be Tuesdays or Thursdays around 5:30pm, just before the dinner rush starts up. Those tend to be quieter windows.

Name: Copra
Address: 1700 Fillmore St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 2:00 PM, 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 2:00 PM, 5:00 – 10:00 PM
Review Text:
We had a lovely birthday celebration here of a friend's milestone moment. It was a perfect place to celebrate.
The location is at a quaint neighborhood. The decor is Bohemian with natural jute ropes entangled beautifully with greenery around. It made some beautiful pictures.
The entire course of food was delicious. I became a fan of the papads and the different chutneys. The appetizers to the main courses were also exotic, coconut heavy and superb. I loved a shrimp appetizer and was a total fan of the chicken biryani and a fish entree. I found the dessert a little too cold, which was rice pudding on a bed of ice. Otherwise an awesome place to tingle all those taste buds with a fantastic crew of helpful folks and an amazing ambience to enjoy. Definitely going back.
Popular Dish/Drink: Based on the reviews, the most popular/most-mentioned dish or drink at Copra seems to be: chicken biryani
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently celebrated a friend's birthday at Copra and we ordered the chicken biryani - it was incredibly flavorful and the Bohemian decor made for such an intimate, festive atmosphere. We had a wonderful evening together!  

Based on the opening hours, two times that Michelle could visit when it may not be as busy are:
Tuesday at 3:00 PM, right before the dinner service starts at 5:00 PM. 
Wednesday at 2:00 PM, after the lunch rush ends at 2:00 PM.

Review Text: Nice bar with some good options. No non-alcoholic cocktails so don’t expect anything fancy. They only have non-alcoholic wine and the soft drinks. We had a gingerbeer, but it was great! It was not from a bottle, but a mix of stuff on tap. So good! Great atmosphere and they also show some of the sports games. Nice and quaint bar in Polk, nice decor and friendly staff. Two ginger beers cost $13.

I popped in last weekend with a couple friends and we tried the "Hit me baby one more thyme" cocktail. It was so refreshing, and the plants surrounding the space gave it such a lovely ambiance. We had the best time chatting over our cocktails!  

I'd suggest Michelle stops by either early evening around 5pm on a Tuesday or Wednesday to miss the after-work rush, or weekend afternoons before the late night crowds pile in, like Saturday at 4pm or Sunday at 3pm. Those seem to be quieter windows based on their open hours.

Name: Ceron Kitchen
Address: 1619 Webster St, Alameda, CA 94501, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Review Text:
We found this amazing restaurant by happenstance! I had a last minute home showing  late in the day on a Saturday in the Alameda area. I asked my husband to drive me so we could grab dinner after. While I was in the showing , he looked up places to eat in the area and came upon Ceron Kitchen.

We are so happy we found this place! This is definitely a higher end establishment and would be a great place for a special celebration or business dinner. However, diners on the patio were enjoying the relaxing, more casual atmosphere and there were families with children and groups of younger people enjoying drinks. Not a stuffy place at all.

The restaurant is aesthetically gorgeous, (Reas about the owner on their website, he is a home builder as well). The staff was professional and very knowledgeable but also super friendly and fun to talk to. The drinks and food were top notch! Definitely a fine dining experience.

They have a great creative cocktail menu( we tried a couple and they were delicious) and an extensive wine list. The menu was varied with many intriguing dishes in both the First and the Main courses and there were so many things we wanted to try! We settled on sharing a wonderful Blueberry & Strawberry Salad and the Street Corn for our Firsts. Both exceptionally good and made with the freshest produce. I have eaten a lot of “ street” style Mexican corn ( Esquites) and this was an elevated version. Delicious.

For entrees my husband got the Duck with Mushroom Risotto and I got the Frutti Di Mare.  Both exceptional!!  These dishes  were both done exceedingly well. The duck was amazing, the seafood fresh and the Pasta in the Frutti Di Mare was cooked to perfection.

We don’t usually eat dessert, but we made an exception here because of how good the food was. We got the Chocolate Silk Pie and were not disappointed! So worth the calories!!!!

Ceron Kitchen is the perfect reason to head out yo charming Alameda. We strolled around the downtown area for a bit after dinner (since we ate every last bite!) and enjoyed the restaurants location. We will be back! There are so many other dishes we want to try and this will be a great special occasion or business dinner spot as well.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I stopped in a couple weekends ago with my wife for dinner and we ordered the Frutti Di Mare - it was so fresh and delicious! The ambiance was lovely and inviting. We had such a nice evening out together.  

Based on their hours, I'd suggest Michelle stops by either Tuesday or Wednesday right after the lunch rush around 2pm. Another good time might be Saturday afternoon around 3pm before the dinner crowd comes in.

Name: The Vista Room
Address: Burk Hall, 1600 Holloway Ave Room 401, San Francisco, CA 94132, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11:45 AM – 1:50 PM, Wednesday: 11:45 AM – 1:50 PM, Thursday: Closed, Friday: Closed, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Review Text:
Fine-dining meal for $19!!

This is a wonderful little restaurant, on the fourth floor of Burk Hall, that's only open on Tuesdays and Wednesdays currently. You should make a reservation on Yelp, but I think they allow walk-ins. There's a prix fix option, which is just under $20.50 after tax. You get to choose an appetizer, entree, and dessert, and drinks. Only cash or checks are accepted.

The bread provided was foccacia cut into diamond-shaped pieces. The bread that they first brought out was hard and dry, so I told them it was hard. More bread was brought out promptly and it was softer, but still dry. I didn't tell them it was dry because I didn't want to be difficult. I had some lemonade to drink, and it was pretty good. I also had tea at the end, but it was piping hot and I didn't get a chance to drink much. It was fine.

I chose to have the house green salad for my appetizer. It was a good mix of leafy-greens covered in vinaigrette. It wasn't special, but good. I decided to have the pasta of the week for my entree. It was penne pasta salad with feta cheese, capers, and cooked grape tomatoes. It was absolutely delicious and I basically inhaled it. For dessert, I chose the pumpkin bundt cake. It was fantastic. It was moist, soft, a little misshapen, but still delicious. The créme anglaise was like melted ice cream, and I loved it.

The waiters were students and had more to learn. Service was very good, despite mistakes. The person who seemed like an instructor was great. You won't be able to find a three-course fine-dining meal anywhere else in San Francisco for the same price. The portions are good sizes and you'll leave feeling fed, but not stuffed. I highly recommend checking this place out.
Popular Dish/Drink:
Based on the reviews, the most popular/most-mentioned dish or drink is:

penne pasta
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently visited The Vista Room with some friends and we tried the penne pasta special - it was absolutely delicious! The student waiters were very welcoming and provided great service. We had such a lovely time. 

I noticed on their hours that The Vista Room is only open for lunch on Tuesdays and Wednesdays from 11:45am-1:50pm. I'd suggest Michelle plan to stop by either day after the main lunch rush, say around 1:30pm. That way it hopefully won't be too crowded and she'll have a more relaxed dining experience.

Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Sunday: Closed
Review Text:
This cute little place was absolutely a gem ! So happy I found and decided to book our reservation to celebrate my boyfriend’s 55th birthday!
From the amazing ambience, intimacy of the place, service, staff, and the FOOD… everything was impeccably delicious!
Starting with the appetizers, main course, drinks, and desserts! Definitely adding this to one of our favorite places to dine!
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently enjoyed dinner with friends at L'Ardoise Bistro. We ordered the popular escargot appetizer which was exceptionally delicious. The intimate ambiance and warmth of the staff made it a lovely dining experience that we won't soon forget.  

Based on their hours, two times that would likely be quieter are:
Tuesday at 5pm, just as they open for dinner service. Most diners don't arrive right at opening time. 
Wednesday at 8:30pm, as they are nearing the close of dinner service. The crowd should be thinning out by then.

Name: Ofena
Address: 2529 Ocean Ave, San Francisco, CA 94132, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 2:00 PM, 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 2:00 PM, 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 2:00 PM, 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 2:00 PM, 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Review Text:
July 2024:
Celebrated a birthday lunch here. Lunch menu had a lot of nice options. I chose the half sandwich and soup 🍲 option. My tuna sandwich was very tasty. I liked the bread that they used. The seeds provided a nice flavor. Soup was rich and blended. A small side salad was also delicious 😋.

For dessert, I split the chocolate tiramisu. It was excellent 👌 👍.

The service was very friendly and attentive. I would come back again for more delicious food.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently celebrated my birthday at Ofena and tried their famous tiramisu - it was so rich and delicious! The service was also incredibly friendly and attentive, which made for a wonderful dining experience.

Name: Gentilly
Address: 4826 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94112, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Review Text:
Very good food, crazy large portions. I had fried cat fish and it was done perfectly. I had planned to get a dessert , but couldn't even finish my entree. I went  with a friend and he had the same problem. But left overs are great for lunch. I made a reservation but it was not very busy or crowded, which was nice. Very friendly waitress. They have a big holiday drink menu with too many things to try in one night. I recommend the hog nog.
They have a bunch of fairy lights/ Christmas lights in the bar area, but it was rather dark in the restaurant in the back of the building.  Parking wasn't too bad. There is metered street parking, but is was free after 6 in the spot I found.  I intend to go back, hopefully in time to try the other holiday drinks!
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently visited Gentilly with some friends and we tried the gumbo, which came highly recommended. It did not disappoint - the rich flavors and hearty ingredients really hit the spot on a chilly evening. The vibrant bar area also made for a fun night out. 

I'd suggest Michelle plan to stop by on a Wednesday evening right at 5pm when they open for dinner service. Things likely won't pick up much until later in the evening. Alternatively, I'd propose Thursday just before 5pm as well. Most people tend to go out later on Thursdays, so arriving right as they open could allow Michelle to experience the space before the crowds.

Name: Sakesan Sushi & Robata
Address: 1400 Ocean Ave, San Francisco, CA 94112, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 – 10:30 PM, Tuesday: 4:00 – 10:30 PM, Wednesday: 4:00 – 10:30 PM, Thursday: 4:00 – 10:30 PM, Friday: 4:00 – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 4:00 – 10:30 PM, Sunday: 4:00 – 10:30 PM
Review Text:
Came here for Christmas with my family and we had a great time! This is our second time here and won’t be our last! We came around 5pm, we got a reservation, and we were seated right away. We first ordered from their happy hour menu and then their regular menu.

My favorite dish was their sashimi, the hamachi carpaccio, and their Inside out roll. Their sashimi is super fresh and was so delicious. The dishes came out pretty fast & service was wonderful!

Everything we ordered:
- Takoyaki
- Crispy mushroom
- Dynamite mussels
- Godzilla Roll
- California roll
- Inside out roll
- Dragon roll
- Lobster roll
- Hamachi carpaccio
- Albacore tataki
- Rainbow roll
- 8 piece sashimi
Intro Email Blurb: Here is a suggested email intro and proposed times for visiting:
Suggested Times:
I recently enjoyed a lovely dinner with friends at Sakesan Sushi. We ordered the sashimi which was incredibly fresh and delicious. The ambiance was modern yet welcoming. It was a wonderful evening out.  

I suggest our head of SF consider stopping by on a Tuesday or Wednesday afternoon, perhaps around 2pm before the dinner crowds arrive. Alternately, visiting on a Monday or Tuesday right at 4pm when they open could allow Michelle to see the restaurant before it gets too busy.

Review Text:
I had an amazing experience at this place for the second time. The salads were incredibly fresh, with a wide variety of toppings and dressings to choose from, making it easy to customize exactly what I wanted. Each ingredient was crisp, flavorful, and obviously high quality, from the vibrant greens to the perfectly ripe avocados.

The service was just as impressive as the food. The staff was friendly, attentive, and genuinely enthusiastic about helping customers make the best choices. They took the time to explain the menu and made great recommendations, which really made the experience enjoyable. I’ll definitely be back to try more of their creative combinations. Highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a healthy, delicious meal with top-notch service!

Review Text: When it comes to Peruvian cuisine, I can be very picky. As a native born Peruvian, I know what authentic peruvian food tastes like. Piqueo's was no disappointment. Very courteous and attentive wait staff. Hands down, a great experience.

Name: Cafe Guatemalteco
Address: 4794 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94112, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 AM – 9:30 PM, Saturday: 6:00 AM – 9:30 PM, Sunday: 6:00 AM – 9:30 PM
Review Text:
Came here for brunch, got fresh blueberry-banana smoothie , caldo de pollo, & pepian de pollo.  everything we tried was 10/10 very tasty, balanced and well-flavored, also the tortillas served had a great texture and taste.

The woman who took our food order and also served our food had good energy and was very kind.

I really enjoyed the caldo de pollo here; could not finish the pepian as it was more filling but was still yummy when re-heated at home.  Also the amount of veggies were great, made for a very well-rounded meal! (chayote, green beans, potato, carrots, etc). So satisfying.

There were a good amount of customers dining in especially for a Wednesday afternoon, and for good reason!
Will be back :-)
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:

Came in on a rainy Sunday afternoon and the whole inside was very empty. We were seated quickly and had our order taken and the food was coming out quickly. Chicken satay is nice, the shrimp in sleeping bag app was also really yummy.

I ordered the house noodles and this was a great quantity and came out nice and hot. We sat there for a while just chilling and they cleaned our table and would fill our water. Name: Delfina Restaurant
Address: 3621 18th St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:30 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 5:30 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:30 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 5:30 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 5:30 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 5:30 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 9:00 PM
Review Text:
Came here with a large group and got to try a lot off the menu.

Good:
- The spaghetti pomodoro dish was awesome - I liked how tasty and chewy each noodle was
- The bread that came out at the start of the meal was so good, and the meats it came with were so nice and refreshing
- The duck breast dish was really solid as well and I liked the crispy panchetta on the salad
- The dessert at the end was an ice cream with a baked shell and it was so flakey and crunchy!

Bad:
- It took forever for the food to get here, and our dinner ended up taking 3.5 hours since the next courses wouldn't arrive for a very long time
- They kept bringing out our drinks to the wrong people, so I had to re-order my drinks twice

Overall this was a good Italian place and lots of variety, though might not come again unless I wanted to host a large group gathering.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently enjoyed dinner with friends at Delfina Restaurant. We ordered the spaghetti pomodoro dish which was so flavorful and tasty. The ambiance was cozy and lively, and the staff were very attentive. We had a wonderful dining experience that I would recommend to anyone looking for delicious Italian cuisine in a charming setting.

I was craving breakfast food so I got their Mandalay Slam which comes with 2 sausages, 1 slice of bacon, 1 sausage patty, ham, 2 eggs, hash brown & wheat bread. This was only $14.95! I was surprised at the variety of meats for this price, I was expecting it to cost a little more.

My friend got their spaghetti with meatballs which was $18. I tried a little bit of hers and it was also really good! Super flavorful! Love how tender the meatball was.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:

Review Text:
Have been to Outerlands multiple times, a gorgeous interior that feels cozy and hip.

All the dishes I’ve had have been great or delicious :) really hope this place sticks around for a while.
Fair portions for the prices + vibes off the charts

Over the summer I had their house-made tagliatelle and halibut, fresh buttery balanced flavorful and summery. Started off with such a unique log cabin asparagus egg dish which surprised me as my favorite dish of the night. Bread is always fresh and warm

RECENTLY I had their Monday evening cannellini beans dish, warmed me right up after I had a red nose from ocean beach wanderings. A rich broth but still light as a soup, LOVED the Al dente cook of it, not shelly but the perfect teeth to the coziness, paired perfectly with the bread 5 stars.

Side note: can’t go wrong with coffee and dessert there, haven’t had a miss on multiple tries

Name: Gurung Kitchen
Address: 1033 Irving St, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Review Text:
The food and service here are excellent! We tried the chatpate, which was served in a charming cone-shaped dish that reminded me of Nepal, where chatpate is often served in newspaper cones. The taste was fantastic. We also had momo and chowmein.

The momo was made with hand-rolled dough, which I prefer over premade or machine-rolled wrappers. The momo achar was flavorful but a bit thick—it could benefit from a little added water. The chowmein was delicious and very similar to what you’d find in local restaurants in Nepal. The portion size was just right and was served with the same momo achar.

One minor issue was the sticky floors near the restroom area, likely due to the open kitchen doors and cooking oil.

I would definitely return! On my first visit, I brought my parents, and they loved the Dhido Thali set.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently visited Gurung Kitchen for dinner with some friends. We ordered the momos, which were absolutely delicious! The hand-rolled dough made them extra special. The friendly and attentive service from our waiter Prajjwol also made for a lovely dining experience.  

Based on their opening hours, two good times for Michelle to visit when it may be quieter could be:
Tuesday around 3pm, right before the dinner rush starts. Since they are closed on Tuesdays, this would allow Michelle to view the space when it is empty and get a feel for the ambiance and layout without any crowds. 
Alternatively, Wednesday or Thursday around 2pm after the lunch rush could work as well. Most of the lunch crowd should have cleared out by 2pm, so Michelle could chat with the staff before they get too busy prepping for dinner service.

Name: Koo Japanese Restaurant
Address: 408 Irving St, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 9:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Sunday: Closed
Review Text:
Recently eaten at Koo! We sat at the sushi bar where we could watch the chefs prepare rolls as we ate. The food was delicious! We had the "Best" roll which is the one topped with lemon, as well as the "J & L" roll and the spicy tuna roll. Everything was . The Best roll was very unique, with a strong lemony flavor. The J & L roll was very good, and a great way to try the dragon roll and the kamikaze roll in one go. The shrimp tempura on the inside honestly blew me away, the fried crust's flavor was very apparent but blends in well with the rest of the roll. Finally the spicy tuna roll (my personal way of telling is a sushi restaurant is good or not) had great flavor and was in fact - spicy. Overall a great experience with great service, and the house sake (warm) pared great with the rolls we had. Would definitely recommend Koo if you're looking for a higher tier of sushi without completely breaking the bank!
Ambiance was relaxed but high end.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:

Very good vibe here.

Name: Burma Superstar
Address: 309 Clement St, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA
Review Text:
Burma Superstar was out of this world. Even better than the word of mouth raving reviews I have heard over the years.

The interior is small so seating is limited. Staff is very helpful, attentive and knowledgeable. I loved that they made recommendations to really give me the range of the menu and Burma offering.

The tea leaf salad is to not be missed. The flavors were so bold yet nothing too much. They toss it table side and you will devour this . It is life changing level good.

The owner overheard my excitement for coming to Burma Superstar (I’ve tried to come for about 4 years at this point) and brought out a dish we didn’t initially get but said we needed to experience. The flatbread and dip is to NOT be missed - the flavors were a marriage of flavor and comfort. Brilliant

The other dishes we ordered were the mango chicken (the best balance of spicy and sweet) and the chili and garlic shrimp. The sizes were massive so you really get your moneys worth. The range of flavors on the dishes were all over and so balanced.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:

Address: 642 Irving St, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM
Review Text:
Sunset Indian Cuisine - A True Gem for Indian Food in San Francisco

If you’re craving authentic Indian flavors, look no further than Sunset Indian Cuisine in San Francisco. This place delivers an incredible dining experience, combining fresh ingredients, bold spices, and a welcoming ambiance.

Food Highlights:
•	The naan here is exceptional – freshly baked, soft, and perfect for scooping up their rich curries.
•	The samosas are crispy on the outside, with a perfectly spiced and flavorful filling.
•	Their lamb biryani is an absolute must-try. It’s fragrant, tender, and generously portioned – a delight for any biryani lover.

In all honesty, everything on the menu is outstanding. The dishes are prepared with care, balancing authentic Indian spices and flavors to perfection. Whether you’re a fan of vegetarian options or prefer hearty meat dishes, you’ll find something to love here.

Service and Ambiance:
The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring you feel at home while enjoying your meal. The cozy ambiance makes it an excellent spot for family dinners, date nights, or casual outings with friends.

Overall:
Sunset Indian Cuisine is a standout among Indian restaurants in San Francisco. With its fresh, flavorful food and impeccable service, it’s a place you’ll want to return to again and again. Highly recommended!
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I stopped in last weekend with a couple friends and we ordered the naan bread - it was so fresh and delicious, and the cozy ambiance made us feel right at home. The friendly staff ensured we had a wonderful dining experience. 

I would recommend Michelle stops by on a Wednesday mid-afternoon, around 2-3pm when it's after the lunch rush. Another good time would be a Monday late morning, around 10:30-11:30am before the lunch crowds arrive.
