Name: Causwells
Address: 2346 Chestnut St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 10:30 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Review Text: My husband and I came into the city for date night and settled on dining at Causwells. They are definitely our new favorite spot! All of the staff are friendly, we were shown to our seats with menus set. Our sever was extremely kind and attentive. We ordered poke to share, as well as the 100 layer potatoes and brussel sprouts. We also had the crispy chicken sandwich and the cavatelli ( everything was absolutely delicious). Our only real regret about dinner was not ordering dessert! we’ll definitely be coming here again.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently visited Causwells with some friends on a Friday evening. We ordered the popular Americana burger, which was absolutely delicious! The staff was also incredibly friendly and attentive during our meal. It was such a fun night out. 

I would recommend Michelle plan to visit on a Wednesday for lunch, right as they open at 11am. Another good option could be Tuesday evening around 8pm, after the dinner rush has died down. Both of those times should allow Michelle to experience the restaurant when it's more relaxed.

Name: Thai Spice Restaurant
Address: 1730 Polk St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
Review Text:
Absolutely loved the ambiance and the charming antique Thai vibe of this place! I’m all about bold flavors, and bland just won’t cut it.
I ordered the Khao Soi with tofu and veggies, and the curry was bursting with flavour(not too intense but subtle and delicious). Even the tofu was marinated perfectly—it tasted amazing! I also tried the Crab Rangoon, which was creamy and delicious (kinda like samosa stuffed with crab meat and a dreamy creamy sauce).
Definitely coming back for that Khao Soi!
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently tried the Pad Thai at Thai Spice with some friends, and we all agreed it was delicious! The antique decor created such a charming, cozy atmosphere that we ended up staying for hours. 

Based on their opening hours, I'd suggest Michelle plan to stop by either on a Wednesday or Thursday afternoon right after the lunch rush, around 2:45 PM. Another good option might be Saturday late afternoon around 4:30 PM, before the dinner crowd starts arriving.

Review Text: This place is absolutely amazing. My sister and I visited to end our trip with a nice dinner. The staff was amazing, the atmosphere was even better. Everyone was so attentive we didn't want for anything. The drinks were top tier and the food was amazing. On top of all that learning that they have a youth hire program and the entire staff is learning skills while earning money was stunning.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently visited Old Skool Cafe and tried the Drink, which was so tasty. The ambiance was delightful - the live music and Victorian décor really made for a one-of-a-kind atmosphere. My friends and I had a wonderful evening.  

Based on their opening hours, two good times for Michelle to visit when it may be quieter could be Wednesday at 4:30 PM, just as they open for dinner service, or Saturday after lunch before the dinner rush starts, maybe around 3 PM.

Name: Ungrafted
Address: 2419 3rd St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Review Text: Fantastic food from Chef David Aviles, trained at Acadia and other fine restaurants in Chicago. Here the dishes are familiar and approachable, with a spicy twist or a zest of surprise. Great selection of wines, beers and some interesting non-alcoholic options (try their sparkling Riesling!) Warm-industrial setting, knowledgeable and friendly staff.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently tried the chicken sandwich at Ungrafted and it was fantastic! The industrial-chic ambiance made for such a fun, lively atmosphere. My friends and I had a wonderful night out.  

I would recommend Michelle stop by on a Wednesday around 2pm before the dinner rush starts. Another good option is Thursday afternoon around 3pm. Both Wednesdays and Thursdays tend to be slower days, so arriving between lunch and dinner would allow Michelle to check things out when it's quieter.

Name: Flour + Water
Address: 2401 Harrison St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Tuesday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM
Review Text:
I had an extraordinary dining experience at Flour + Water last night. Despite arriving without a reservation, the warm and welcoming hosts accommodated us graciously and even recommended an excellent nearby bar while we waited. The atmosphere was intimate yet inviting, with dim lighting that perfectly set the mood while still showcasing the stunning presentation of the dishes. The playlist added to the ambiance—it was impeccably curated by Andy, the music director, whom we were lucky enough to chat with. Our servers, Christian and Alfredo, were knowledgeable and friendly.

We opted for the nine-course pasta tasting menu, which was nothing short of transformative. Our journey began with the amberjack crudo, a bright and vibrant opener. Since I don’t eat seafood, my substitute—perfectly ripe Haas avocado—was creamy and refreshing, setting a lovely tone for the meal. The next course, today’s ricotta, was a masterclass in balance. The creamy ricotta paired beautifully with the sweetness of huckleberry jam and the slight tang of sourdough tigelle, creating a delightful interplay of flavors.

The cacio e pepe arancini was a playful yet elevated take on the Roman classic. Each bite was perfectly crisp on the outside, giving way to a rich, peppery interior that delivered the comforting essence of cacio e pepe in a whole new form. Following this was the standout of the evening: the black truffle sformato. With its understated presentation, the dish allowed the flavors to shine. The rich, velvety truffle custard was expertly balanced by the creaminess of parmigiano, while the crispy potato provided textural contrast. A delicate drizzle of truffle honey added a hint of sweetness that elevated the dish to perfection—easily one of the best things I’ve ever tasted.

Next came the saffron corzetti, a delicate and aromatic dish. Although I skipped the trout, my substitution—a cabbage-forward preparation—was refreshing and light, with subtle herbal notes that kept the dish bright. The squash cappelletti was a standout pasta course for me, showcasing an incredible balance of flavors. The cocoa bean and brown butter sauce added richness, while the salsa macha brought just the right amount of spice to elevate the dish without overpowering it.

The tortellini en brodo was pure comfort in a bowl. The tender tortellini, filled with earthy matsutake mushroom and creamy fontina, was perfectly complemented by the warming, deeply flavorful broth. Drinking the broth felt like a warm hug—this dish was a personal favorite. The meal then transitioned to heartier flavors with the veal ravioli, where the rye and rainbow chard added depth, and the currant mostarda brought a subtle sweetness that made the dish shine. Paired with the acorn orecchiette, it was a perfect juxtaposition. The orecchiette’s charred broccolini and Calabrian chili offered a smoky, spicy edge.

This tasting menu was a masterful progression, moving seamlessly from light and fresh to rich and indulgent. Every dish was cooked to perfection and thoughtfully constructed to create a cohesive culinary journey. Flour + Water has completely redefined my understanding of Italian cuisine, and I cannot wait to return to explore more of their artistry. Luckily, we live in the neighborhood!
Popular Dish/Drink: Based on the reviews, the most mentioned dish or drink is pasta. Various pasta dishes like cacio e pepe arancini, black truffle sformato, saffron corzetti, squash cappelletti, tortellini en brodo, veal ravioli, and acorn orecchiette are discussed frequently across the reviews.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently enjoyed a lovely dinner at Flour + Water with some friends. We ordered several of their decadent pasta dishes like the saffron corzetti and squash cappelletti. The food was incredible, and the atmosphere was so cozy and romantic. 

I would recommend Michelle stop by on a Wednesday around 5:30 pm, right as they open for dinner. Alternatively, I'm sure arriving around 8:30 pm on a Monday or Tuesday would work as well, as it seems those are typically slower nights and nearing the end of service.

Name: Gumbo Social
Address: 5176 3rd St, San Francisco, CA 94124, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 3:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 3:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Review Text:
If you're passing through, you have to stop by and pick up a po boy for the road. The owner was so kind and made sure every customer was taken care of.

On my trip I had me the Gumbo. The roux was delicious, homemade, and hit the spot. I had a special item they don't usually have, so mine had a little more fat on top. Normally, they skim the fat off the top.

The favors were rich and full. I could taste the earthiness of the bayleaves, the spices, and the richness of the pork.

I highly recommend if you ever get a chance to pass through.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently visited Gumbo Social with some friends, and we ordered the famous gumbo. It was so rich and flavorful, and the atmosphere inside was warm and lively. The staff was extremely friendly and made us feel right at home. 

I would recommend Michelle stops by on a Wednesday or Thursday afternoon between 2-5pm. Those tend to be quieter hours before the dinner rush starts. Another good option is Saturday between 3-5pm after the main lunch crowd has left.

Name: Tang Bar
Address: 3251 20th Ave Second Floor, San Francisco, CA 94132, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 7:00 PM
Review Text:
I visited Tang Bar after hearing it’s a popular Mala Tang brand in China, and it didn’t disappoint. The restaurant is located inside a mall, so make sure to check their hours — they close at 7 p.m. on Sundays. I arrived at 6:30 p.m., and it was still quite busy with a long line of customers.

At $15.99 per pound, it’s a bit pricey, but the ingredients, from vegetables to meats, were all very fresh, which made it worth it. The process involves lining up to pick your ingredients, so be prepared for some wait time. I spent around $30 and chose the Sichuan spice level, the spiciest option, which was incredibly flavorful and made me sweat — just as I expected!

One thing I found interesting was how many non-Asian customers were dining here. Most of them chose very mild spice levels (0 or 1), resulting in a lighter broth. The overall experience was great, with bold flavors and the perfect amount of spice. If I’m ever in the area again, I’d definitely return!
Popular Dish/Drink: Based on the reviews, there is no single dish or drink that seems most popular or most-mentioned. The reviews focus on discussing the overall tang bar concept, ingredients, broths, seating, wait times, etc. There is no consistent mention of any specific menu item.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently visited Tang Bar with some friends on a weekend evening. We were able to easily customize our own broths and ingredients for a tasty personalized meal. The staff were very friendly and efficient in getting our food out quickly, even when it got busy. 

Based on the opening hours, I would recommend Michelle plan to visit either on a Tuesday or Wednesday afternoon, perhaps around 2pm or 3pm. This timing would allow her to experience Tang Bar when it's not as crowded during prime dinner hours, yet still observe their offerings and operations while customers are dining.

Name: Wei’s Cafe (Jo Jo's Cafe)
Address: 1537 Ocean Ave, San Francisco, CA 94112, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM
Review Text:
Came here after a long run and it filled me up!

Good:
- The curry laksa soup was amazing!
- The baked pork chop was also amazing - so much flavor
- The portion sizes and prices were great- we even took home almost the whole dish since we had so much food left over.
- The place is super clean and modern inside, super cute and nice fairy lights and tons of seating, no wait

Bad:
- The food took a little bit to get to us, and it was really cold inside on a super cold day
- The servers don't speak great english so it's a bit hard to communicate

Overall would come again for the value.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
Paragraph #1
I recently tried the laksa soup at Wei's Cafe and it was delicious! The ambiance was cozy and charming, with cute fairy lights. The servers were also very sweet, even though there was a bit of a language barrier.

Paragraph #2

Name: Tiny Sushi - Oh Baby
Address: 32 Park Plaza Dr, Daly City, CA 94015, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 1:30 PM, 4:30 – 8:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 1:30 PM, 4:30 – 8:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 1:30 PM, 4:30 – 8:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 1:30 PM, 4:30 – 8:30 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 1:30 PM, 4:30 – 8:30 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 1:30 PM, 4:30 – 8:00 PM
Review Text:
Tiny Sushi is a hidden gem that truly lives up to its name. This cozy hole in the wall sushi spot reminds me of Osaka. The intimate atmosphere is a portal straight to Japan.

Jack, our server, is standout. He went above and beyond to ensure a memorable dining experience. His attentiveness to all patrons, particularly his thoughtful care for my parents, showcased the restaurant's commitment to service.

The sushi here is nothing short of exceptional. While the menu isn't extensive, each dish is crafted with care, using fresh ingredients. Their vegetarian sushi options are particularly delicious, we had the “tacos”.

We had both the Chirashi bowl and Omakase. Both fantastic. The mango unagi and double toro are a great contrast of creative and classic.

We spent 180$ for 3 before service and walked out very full. Would recommend ordering less.

Arrive early! Tiny Sushi is first-come, first-served with a written waiting list and no reservations.

Tiny Sushi is a must-visit for anyone looking for delicious sushi. I'll definitely return to when I'm back in town.
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently visited Tiny Sushi with some friends. We ordered the chirashi bowl, which was incredibly fresh and tasty. The cozy atmosphere made us feel right at home, and our server Jack provided exceptional, thoughtful service. It was such an enjoyable dining experience that I can't wait to go back.

Based on their opening hours, I would suggest Michelle stops by on a Tuesday or Wednesday either right when they open for lunch at 11:30 AM, or in the afternoon between lunch and dinner around 2:30 PM. Those times should be less busy so Michelle can get a good feel for the restaurant's vibe.

Name: King's Thai Cuisine #2
Address: 346 Clement St, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Review Text:
I recently had the pleasure of dining at a fantastic Thai restaurant that exceeded my expectations in every way. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with warm smiles and impeccable service, which set the tone for an exceptional dining experience.

For my meal, I started with the duck noodles. The dish was a symphony of flavors, with tender, succulent duck pieces nestled in perfectly cooked noodles. The broth was rich and aromatic, making every bite a delight.

Next, I tried the chicken with cashew nuts and rice. This dish was a perfect balance of textures and flavors. The chicken was juicy and well-seasoned, complemented by the crunch of fresh cashew nuts. The accompanying rice was fluffy and cooked to perfection, making it a satisfying and hearty dish.

Finally, I indulged in the green curry with chicken and rice. The curry was a masterpiece, with a creamy, spicy sauce that was both vibrant and comforting. The chicken was tender and absorbed the curry's flavors beautifully, while the rice served as the perfect accompaniment to soak up every bit of the delicious sauce.

In addition to the fantastic food, the restaurant’s service was outstanding. The staff were attentive and friendly, ensuring that my dining experience was nothing short of excellent. I also appreciated that the restaurant stays open late, making it a great option for a late-night meal.

Overall, I highly recommend this Thai restaurant for its delicious food, excellent service, and convenient hours. It’s a place I’ll definitely be returning to soon!
Intro Email Blurb: Here is the response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently tried the Tom-Kha Soup at King's Thai Cuisine #2 on a late night visit with friends. The soup was creamy and comforting, and the staff was incredibly friendly even though we came in right before closing. We had such a nice, relaxed dining experience.  

I'd recommend Michelle consider stopping by on a Wednesday or Thursday afternoon, perhaps around 2-3pm when things may be slower following the lunch rush. Alternatively, late mornings on Tuesday or Friday around 10:30-11am could be quieter times to visit as well.

The food is packed with bold flavors—highlights include the Lek Pla-Ra, an incredible mix of rice noodles, shrimp, squid, and a tangy fermented fish dressing, and the Grilled Beef Intestines, which were perfectly smoky and tender. The three house-made dipping sauces, especially the cilantro-lime chili one, elevated every bite. The ambiance is vibrant and full of warm, Southeast Asian street-food vibes. Service was friendly and attentive, with great recommendations. Perfect for group dinners or a fun night out. If you love smoky, spicy, and authentic, this place won’t disappoint!

Name: Hotpot Champ
Address: 801 Kearny St, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA
Review Text:
Came here with a group of 9 and we got seated at two different tables. Each table had one giant pot to split.

Good:
- You can choose 2 soups that you want - I loved the tomato soup base since it was nice and savory but not too salty
- I liked how much variety there was in the AYCE options - the Ferris wheel of course is the most famous thing here
- The appetizers were pretty great - there were glass noodles and tons of sauces
- The mango coconut dessert was delicious!
- Nice and private back area for groups

Bad:
- Overall more expensive, about $45pp after taxes

Overall a really fun group activity!
Intro Email Blurb: Here is my response in two paragraphs:
Suggested Times:
I recently visited Hotpot Champ with a group of friends. We ordered the famous Ferris wheel dish which was so tasty! The private back area was perfect for our group to relax and chat while enjoying the hot pot. The mango coconut dessert was the perfect sweet ending to a fun dining experience. 

Based on the opening hours, I would suggest Michelle plan to visit on a Wednesday either right after the lunch rush around 2:30pm or later in the evening around 8:30pm after most people have finished dinner. Another good time might be Saturday afternoon around 3:30-4pm before the dinner crowds arrive.
